--- layout: component title: Grid layout description: '

We use a 12-column responsive grid to give designers and developers a set of layout tools for building responsive web applications. The grid consists of three essential parts:

  1. Container – Sets max-width and adds outer gutters.
  2. Row – Encapsulates columns and offsets outer gutters.
  3. Column – Holds content and adds gutters on either side.

Below are examples of various ways to use the pre-defined grid classes to create responsive layouts.

{% include example-intro.html title='Responsive columns' description='The grid is responsive using the mobile-first approach. So you start by defining the column width for the xs screen size, then again for each screen size where you want the column width to change. If you skip a screen size, it will automatically inherit the size from the next smaller size that was specified. For example, .col-12 .col-md-6 would apply 12 column width to sm screens since the next smaller size is .col-12.' %} {% capture example %}
